availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Lunsford Lindsay (Trigg County, Kentucky, soldier and physician.)

body.p: Trigg County, Kentucky, soldier and physician. Virginia native. Married to Elizabeth Lipscomb Lindsay in Louisa County, Virginia, on March 13, 1815. Father of David Lindsay, George Lindsay, Elizabeth Lindsay, Caroline Lindsay, and Ellen B. Lindsay. Served in Captain William Steven's Company of the Virginia Militia as a sergeant from January 27, 1814, to May 7, 1814. Physician in Trigg County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned five enslaved persons in Trigg County in 1850. Physician in Trigg County in 1860. Owned eighteen enslaved persons in Trigg County in 1860.

ab.bibl:

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, Cadiz, p. 392A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, Cadiz, p. 50A.
Virginia Marriage Records. The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia. Louisa County Marriage Register, Roll 41, vol. 1, p. 157.
War of 1812 Pension and Bounty Land Warrant Application Files, NARA RG 15, Roll RG15-1812PB-Bx2151.
